reviews.review_msg: He is very nice, lectures are interesting sometimes with activities but lecture time is very long so you would feel really tired and hard to focus on the second half of the lecture. The exams are easy and you just need to focus on his PPT, don't really need to read the textbook. He gives really good feedback and he is NOT a tough grader.
John was extremely helpful and was an extremely fair marker. Lectures can be boring at times but he did a good job of making the content interesting.
His lectures can be boring, but he is extremely nice and fair. EDUC222 itself is boring and dry, so its not all his fault. Don't listen to the bad reviews, Nesbit is a nice guy and good prof.
I just really love him
john is a really nice man. he takes effort into consideration. very educated...umm wants his students to succeed and aids in the process.

Ofelia is very disorganized and it feels like she should be teaching a masters class rather than a 2nd yr educ class. Her passion in the topic of research is apparent but it doesnt translate to the best teaching methods. there's weekly quizzes which are decent, usually based on the readings, lecture or lecture slides.

She wasted a lot of time during lectures talking about nothing or figuring out how to work with zoom and that made lectures very long and boring. She very frequently posted assignments on canvas without any warning with a due date on the next day. The lectures were not interesting or worth going to, everything was from the textbook.

I had to teach myself the entire course from the text, she was so disorganized and could not give clear criteria, especially for exams. She often wasted 1-2 hours of our 3 hour class rambling, not talking about chapter content. We had constant weekly assignments and group work that was a total waste of time. Take this course with someone else!

despite being a 2nd year course thats only worth 3 credits, you do so much work! there's weekly quizzes, textbook summarizing notes, homework and in class group assignments almost every class. her lectures are also very disorganized and is not very good at explaining.

She rarely replies to emails and avoids having office hours, also very unorganized (confuses her students). There are weekly assignments and quizzes. You cannot miss a single lecture because she assigns random group assignments during class and makes us submit it by the end of the day. Her lectures are boring and long (goes over the time limit).
Great prof!

She felt almost like a friend to the majority of the class and was hilarious at times. Very approachable, understanding and likes student feedback. I think she gave everyone a 10/10 for presentations which was nice. She is very flexible as she extended the deadline for our final paper.

Great professor. He was so passionate about what he did and was always going out of his way to help all students. I will be glad to take another course from him in future. He is very smart and has deep knowledge about research methodologies. Interestingly, he brings deep passion about his knowledge of educational psychology into teaching research
Great Prof. He was very helpful and has sound knowledge of research methodology
This guy was fun. Knows EVERYONE at SFU - every topic someone was interested in he know who to go see and talk with. Lots of stories about his kid, funny.

Karyn is a fantastic professor.  If you had trouble in her class or didn't find it interesting, I suggest you consider whether that is your own fault.  Karyn puts an amazing amount of effort into her work, really cares about her students and is very passionate about her research (which is important and interesting) and teaching.

I have taken a couple courses with Karyn, Research methods and Early Childhood education and have loved both of them, one of my favorite teachers! She is very passionate and knowledgeable about the material. I also found her own research really interesting and helpful. She isn't easy but if you work hard you will get a lot out of her courses

Karyn needs to learn how to teach.  Lectures were really boring and she spent most of the time talking about her own research which was also very boring.  I hope I do not have Karyn again as a professor.  Sorry i'm harsh, but its the truth.

Karyn was really nice & helpful. She wasn't a hard marker. She discusses her own research and weaves it into the lectures. The lectures were dry but research methods is boring. She takes her notes directly from the textbook & that's basically what you need to study.

She is such a sweetheart. Her lectures were very clear and well planned out and related to the text well, without just restating all the info. Bringing in her own research as examples made the concepts and theories very simple to understand. Her tests were easy if you came to class.  Very approachable if one needed help. Overall a great proff.

mixed evaluation -valid concerns in grading, harder then necessary marker based on a 200 level university course -encourages class discussion, makes initiative to answer questions -DONT take course if applying to grad programs, will bring down GPA -Do take course to upgrade yourself ie. professional development/learn how to do/evaluate research
